titleStmt.title: The heads of, severall petitions and complaints made against 1 Sir Iohn Connyers lievtenant generall of the horse in the northerne expedition. 2 Dr, Heywood of St. Gyles in the Fields. 3 The parishioners of St. Mary-Woolchurch. 4 Dr, Fuller of St, Giles Cripple-gate. 5 Mr, Booth of St. Botolphs Aldersgate. Touching the rayles about the communion table: the pictures in glasse-windowes. And weekely lectures. And read before the committee, October 16. 1641.

The heads of, severall petitions and complaints made against 1 Sir Iohn Connyers lievtenant generall of the horse in the northerne expedition. 2 Dr, Heywood of St. Gyles in the Fields. 3 The parishioners of St. Mary-Woolchurch. 4 Dr, Fuller of St, Giles Cripple-gate. 5 Mr, Booth of St. Botolphs Aldersgate. Touching the rayles about the communion table: the pictures in glasse-windowes. And weekely lectures. And read before the committee, October 16. 1641.

notesStmt.note: Proceedings before the committee of the House of Commons appointed to sit during the recess.
The comma following "2 Dr" (line 9) is inverted.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
